page.title: 03 HOUSING IN AYNHO
page.content: Aynho now has about 10 thatched houses; most of the original thatch having been replaced with slate. The new houses have got tiled roofs. Most of the houses are of stone except for 4 brick houses down by the station. In our village 97(43%) of houses were built before 1918; 37(16%) between 1918 and 1960; 92(41%) since 1960. There are 9 brick houses which have been rendered built 1918-1960. All the houses are very expensive. Most of the modern houses are detached but many of the older cottages are terraced. There are a few semi-detached The modern houses are built on estates called Portway Gardens, Cartwright Gardens, The Butts, The Glebe and Butts Close.
